greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dirichlet inverse of A004718, Per Nørgård's "infinity sequence".
comment: The composer Per Nørgård's name is also written in the OEIS as Per Noergaard.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 1, 1, -Sum[b[n/d] a[d], {d, Most@ Divisors[n]}]];
program: A004718list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to)); v[1]=1; v[2]=-1; for(n=3, up_to, v[n] = if(n%2, v[n>>1]+1, -v[n/2])); (v); }; \\ After code in A004718.

DirInverseCorrect(v) = { my(u=vector(#v)); u[1] = (1/v[1]); for(n=2, #v, u[n] = (-u[1])*sumdiv(n, d, if(d<n, v[n/d]*u[d], 0))); (u) }; \\ Compute the Dirichlet inverse of the sequence given in input vector v (correctly!).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 08 2019
